page.title: 02COTTAGE FARM (1)
page.content: Cottage Farm is located in St. Martin. It has been rented from Brigadier Lempriere-Robin, of{Rosel {Manor.}The area it covers is about 200 vergees (80 acres), twice as large as many Jersey farms. It is a mixed farm, i.e. it is for cattle and crops. There are 63 milking cows, 12 cows under 6 months, 6 6-12-month-old calves, and 12 heifers. The record age for a cow is 24 years old. The average age of the cows on this farm is 3-4 years old. They are marked on their ears, the colour tags tell the farmer how much food to give them. We looked at some calves about eight weeks old, and suddenly noticed the cows had no horns. They had been cut off at three weeks old because they could have hurt each other with them.
